summary: Its basically the Setting Files customized by myself, if you use the normal Settings from the game you will have a lot more FPS with this files (depends on your current System) read the guide !
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][b][center]
The Begin[/center][/b][/size]
[size=3]1. [b]Download Nvidia Inspector[/b] - http://www.chip.de/downloads/Nvidia-Inspector_91769843.html
4. Open Nvidia[b] Profile Inspector[/b] and type in the Profile Textbox (left on top) "Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" press ENTER
5. Change following things: [b]Frame Rate Limiter: 60.7 fps[/b] / [b]Triple Buffering: ON[/b] / [b]Vertical Sync: ON[/b]
6. Press [b]Apply Changes

[/b]7. Download my Setting Files and place it inside your MyGames/Skyrim
[b]IF YOU USE ModOrganizer with local settings[/b] then put it in your current profile ModOrganizer/profiles/Default (if you didn't changed it)
8. [b]OPTIONAL [/b]open the SkyrimPrefs.ini and change it, so it fits with your computer:
SkyrimPrefs.ini -> sD3DDevice="THE NAME OF YOUR GRAPHICS CARD"

[b]You are done[/b], start the game and enjoy higher Framerate with still a quite nice look in my opinion.[/size][size=3]


[/size][center][b][size=4]QQ i still have bad FPS ...[/size]
[/b][size=3]Allright for you some more tipps to Improve your FPS[/size][/center]
[size=3]

[/size][size=3]1. Download BethINI
2. Follow the steps of the program (chose like on we did on top MyGames/Skyrim or ModOrganizer/Profiles if you use MO)
3. Change the check arrow on follow things, on everything we said in The Begin and also
Remove Shadows: ON for Max Performance or downscale it to your liking, Decal Quantity Medium or Low, Field of Range  >74, Depht of Field (uncheck), Water (uncheck everything), Reflection Resolution on lowest, View Distance 10-15 on Object, Actor, Item Fade, Grass and Light on 7500, Distant Object Detail Medium, Decale Fade Poor, Remove Grass or set Density high, uncheck Dynamic Trees.

If you still have bad FPS then downscale the resolution of your Skyrim (you can find resolution for 16:9 online just google)
[/size][size=3]

[/size][center][b][size=4]Other Mods wich can help your Performance[/size]
[/b][size=3]Project Optimization - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32505/[/size]
[size=3]Grass on Steroids .. that name is so awesome - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33582[/size]
[size=3]Low Res Particles and Flora - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53692/[/size]
[size=3]Insignificant Object Remover - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64611/[/size]
[size=3]Bugg Fixes - https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/76747[/size]
[b]and alot more mods outside there ...[/b][/center][size=3]
[/size][size=3]
[b]IF YOU USE ENB: Dont use ENB, use "I Cant Believe Its NOT ENB 3" you safe alot of performance and with good settings you look around and you will think "hey its kinda like ENB" to wow man that looks better then my old ENB O.O and 20 more FPS WOOOOOW ....

[/b][center][b]Test new ENB's or ReShades without anoying backup ur old data and delete them manualy ... [/b]
https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/7804/ 
the easy way is the best way ![/center][/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3][center][b]I think my Framerate are now quite good but i miss the DOF of my old ENB :([/b]
Dont worry my friend, i know how you feel ... check this out: https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12525
it cost less performance but you still have a good static DOF even a dynamic DOF[/center][/size]
author: Pickelsturn the King of Pickles
